intro: Paraboea uniflora, commonly known as the single-flower paraboea, is a flowering plant native to the eastern regions of Australia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as rainforests and understoreys. Its leaves are usually elliptical and have a smooth texture, while its flowers are white or pale pink. Paraboea uniflora is often found in association with other understory plants and contributes to the biodiversity of its habitat.
